critique: This document is an executive order regarding pay and management of federal employees. It directs agencies to use existing authorities to maintain a high quality workforce, motivate employees, and ensure fair pay. It also designates agencies to prescribe rules for converting pay rates and establishes guidelines for special rates for recruitment and retention. The order emphasizes the use of the General Schedule system for human resources utilization and provides guidance on step-increases and higher rates of pay. There is nothing explicitly ideological in the document. It seems to be focused on efficient management of the federal workforce. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
